abstract: Google is actively positioning its deal for Motorola Mobility not as a means to buy its way into the handset market, but as an opportunity to buy a portfolio of 17,000 patents.
snippet: Google is actively positioning its deal for Motorola Mobility not as a means to buy its way into the handset market, but as an opportunity to buy a portfolio of 17,000 patents.
lead_paragraph: Matthew Staver/Bloomberg NewsLarry Page, a Google co-founder, left, and Eric Schmidt, the former chief executive, in Sun Valley, Idaho, in 2009.

headline.main: Is Google Turning Into a Mobile Phone Company? No, It Says
